metadata.Title: CVE-2017-6542 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
The ssh_agent_channel_data function in PuTTY before 0.68 allows remoteattackers to have unspecified impact via a large length value in an agentprotocol message and leveraging the ability to connect to the Unix-domainsocket representing the forwarded agent connection, which trigger a bufferoverflow.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-6542` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

pterm - 0.67-3build0.16.04.1
putty - 0.67-3build0.16.04.1
putty-tools - 0.67-3build0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: putty package in esm-apps/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.67-3build0.16.04.1').
